html.p: Definition. Given a vector space [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] over [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R[/mathjaxinline], an inner product on [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] is any rule that assigns a scalar [mathjaxinline]\langle v,w\rangle \in \mathbb R[/mathjaxinline] to any pair [mathjaxinline]v,w\in V[/mathjaxinline] which satisfies the following properties:

li.p: [mathjaxinline]\langle u+v,w \rangle = \langle u,w\rangle + \langle v,w\rangle[/mathjaxinline] for all [mathjaxinline]u,v,w \in V[/mathjaxinline].
[mathjaxinline]\langle av, w\rangle = a\langle v,w \rangle[/mathjaxinline] for all [mathjaxinline]v,w\in V[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]a\in \mathbb R[/mathjaxinline].
